definition.tooltip_value: Conjunto uniforme de pareceres o de votos que...
definition.value: Conjunto uniforme de pareceres o de votos que predomina en una discusión o votación, sin llegar a más de la mitad de los emitidos.

references.text: Cabanellas, G.: Diccionario Enciclopédico de Derecho Usual, Heliasta, Buenos Aires, 1981

contexts.context: "This means that a decision is taken when there are more votes for than against. Each Member of the Council has one vote. The simple majority is applicable when the Treaty does not provide otherwise (Article 205(1) EC). It is thus the decision-making process found in ordinary law. In practice it applies to only a small number of decisions: internal Council rules, organisation of the Council secretariat, and the rules governing committees provided for in the Treaty."

definition.tooltip_value: Greater number of votes cast on a piece of le...
definition.value: Greater number of votes cast on a piece of legislation, enough to ensure it is adopted when an absolute or qualified majority is not required
